body: We are having the same problems. So with latest CLI it breaks a current working version.

@roberth1988 I doubt they were generated before (but correct me if i'm wrong).
This was intended as a feature request to avoid writing your own tedious literal-to-pointer converters, however simple, should probably be automated by API stub generator.
@iamtakingiteasy no this has never been the case. Looks like this is a request for enhancement.

@roberth1988 you are converting incompatible types (pointer vs non-pointer).

What is interesting here is that it seems that you used to get a non-pointer value for a required property and no this field is generated as a pointer. Could you share the spec that generates this model. I'd be interested to figure out why it used to be non-pointer and the target generated type has changed with v0.26.

ok so there are different mixed issues here:
- @roberth1988 's actual problem is that for some reason, the codegen moved some fields to pointers when they were not.
- @iamtakingiteasy  's point is indeed an enhancement. I am showing a proposal below.

@roberth1988 your issue is different, even though it shares the same symptoms. Could you please open a separate issue with your spec and excerpts of generated code before/after v0.26.0, so we can help you out more efficiently?
